intro: Allocarya diffusa, commonly known as the diffuse Allocarya, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves that are often finely divided. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, a typical feature of the Apiaceae family. Allocarya diffusa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks.
